comment.body:
Thanks for submitting your first pull request! You are awesome! :hugs:
If you haven't done so already, check out [Jupyter's Code of Conduct](https://github.com/jupyter/governance/blob/master/conduct/code_of_conduct.md). Also, please make sure you followed the pull request template, as this will help us review your contribution more quickly. ![welcome](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jupyterlab/.github/master/images/welcome.jpg) You can meet the other [Jovyans](https://jupyter.readthedocs.io/en/latest/community/content-community.html?highlight=jovyan#what-is-a-jovyan) by joining our [Discourse forum](http://discourse.jupyter.org/). There is also a intro thread there where you can stop by and say Hi! :wave:
Welcome to the Jupyter community! :tada:

issue.title: Remote CLI launch doesnt not persist session data
issue.body:
Just tried the new CLI remote launch in 4.0.7-1 which was exciting to streamline getting on my cluster, but it looks like it doesn't persist session data even for the same URL. So e.g. 

```bash
$ jlab https://jupyter.mycluster.com
# log in via my clusters web interface in the jupyterlab window
# close jupyterlab
$ jlab https://jupyter.mycluster.com
# have to log in again
```

which makes it actually _less_ streamlined than using the GUI "recent sessions" (which does correctly persist sessions). Would be great if CLI calls with the same URL persisted data.

issue.title: Development with m1 mac issues with create_env_installer:mac (osx-arm64)
issue.body:
## Description Following the [local development guide](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/a438bf232ac929729a6822561d96ac200e420fd7/dev.md#local-development), I'm running into an issue with the `yarn create_env_installer:` step, receiving the error: `Platform in lockfile 'osx-64' is not compatible with system platform 'osx-arm64'.` On further inspection it looks that all the `conda-osx-64.lock` is downloading all packages for osx-64 currently. Is there any devs using M1 macs that have a workaround to get conda working for local development? These issues after installing conda via miniforge3 and all relevant conda dependencies. ## Reproduce 1. Go to [developer documentation](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/a438bf232ac929729a6822561d96ac200e420fd7/dev.md#developer-documentation) 2. Follow the instructions on an M1 macbook 3. once at the `yarn create_env_installer:mac` step 4. See error ``` yarn create_env_installer:mac yarn run v1.22.19 warning ../../package.json: No license field $ yarn clean_env_installer && conda-lock install --prefix ./env_installer/jlab_server ./env_installer/conda-osx-64.lock && conda pack -p ./env_installer/jlab_server -o ./env_installer/jlab_server.tar.gz warning ../../package.json: No license field $ rimraf ./env_installer/jlab_server.tar.gz && conda env remove -p ./env_installer/jlab_server -y Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/conda_lock/conda_lock.py", line 1477, in install do_validate_platform(lockfile_contents) File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/conda_lock/conda_lock.py", line 195, in do_validate_platform raise PlatformValidationError( conda_lock.errors.PlatformValidationError: Platform in lockfile 'osx-64' is not compatible with system platform 'osx-arm64'. During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/bin/conda-lock", line 10, in sys.exit(main()) File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1157, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1078, in main ``` ## Expected behavior yarn create_env_installer:mac creates the local python installer and local development works. ## Context - Operating System and version: MacOS Ventura 13.4.1 - JupyterLab-Desktop version: 4.0.6-1 - Installer: local development? .dmg
Troubleshoot Output 
Paste the output from running `jupyter troubleshoot` from the terminal inside of JupyterLab Desktop here.
You may want to sanitize the paths in the output.
Browser Output (required for interface issues after loading) 
Paste the output from the DevTools JavaScript console here, if applicable.
Logs (required for issues with loading, server and startup) 
Paste the logs from the `main.log` file here (optionally also from `renderer.log`).

issue.title: Feature request: connect to existing jupyterlab server using `jlab` command
issue.body:
Recently I noticed support for connecting to existing servers was added (#15), which is awesome. However it seems the `jlab` command does not recognize arguments that are URLs pointing to servers. Could this be added in a future release?

Example: Currently, the following will create a new session and open the specified notebook:

```sh
jlab notebook.ipynb
```

However, this simply opens a new window on the landing page instead of connecting to the server:

```sh
jlab http://127.0.0.1:2001/lab?token=xxx
```

issue.title: Feature request: connect to existing jupyterlab server using `jlab` command
issue.body:
Recently I noticed support for connecting to existing servers was added (#15), which is awesome. However it seems the `jlab` command does not recognize arguments that are URLs pointing to servers. Could this be added in a future release?

Example: Currently, the following will create a new session and open the specified notebook:

```sh
jlab notebook.ipynb
```

However, this simply opens a new window on the landing page instead of connecting to the server:

```sh
jlab http://127.0.0.1:2001/lab?token=xxx
```

comment.body: @lukelbd this feature is now available with v4.0.7-1. Please give it a try and create a new issue if you run into problems. Here is an [example](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop#jlab-command-line-launch-examples).

## Description Following the [local development guide](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/a438bf232ac929729a6822561d96ac200e420fd7/dev.md#local-development), I'm running into an issue with the `yarn create_env_installer:` step, receiving the error: `Platform in lockfile 'osx-64' is not compatible with system platform 'osx-arm64'.` On further inspection it looks that all the `conda-osx-64.lock` is downloading all packages for osx-64 currently. Go to [developer documentation](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/a438bf232ac929729a6822561d96ac200e420fd7/dev.md#developer-documentation) 2. During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/bin/conda-lock", line 10, in sys.exit(main()) File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1157, in __call__ return self.main(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/winstonzhao/miniforge3/lib/python3.10/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1078, in main ``` ## Expected behavior yarn create_env_installer:mac creates the local python installer and local development works. ## Context - Operating System and version: MacOS Ventura 13.4.1 - JupyterLab-Desktop version: 4.0.6-1 - Installer: local development? .dmg

comment.body: @snoolord we now have full support for Apple silicon on Mac with version 4.0.7-1. For local development you can use the new script `yarn create_env_installer:osx-arm64`

release.name: v4.0.7-1
release.body:
## JupyterLab Desktop v4.0.7-1
Make sure to uninstall the previous version before installing the new one by following the [uninstall instructions](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/master/user-guide.md#uninstalling-jupyterlab-desktop).

- Detailed error messages when Python environment is incompatible
- Option to install missing Python packages for incompatible environments
- Access to log files from UI
- Support for remote JupyterLab Server connection by setting URL in CLI
- Upgrade to JupyterLab 4.0.7
- Upgrade to Electron v27
release.short_description_html:
JupyterLab Desktop v4.0.7-1

Make sure to uninstall the previous version before installing the new one by following the uninstall instructions.

  • Detailed error messages when Python environment is in…

Merge pull request #712 from jupyterlab/requirements-not-found-message-and-install

show python requirements not found message and option to install

pull_request.title: show python requirements not found message and option to install
pull_request.body: - Shows relevant error message when Python dependency packages such as `jupyterlab` are not found. - Provides option to copy the command to clipboard and installing the missing packages for user - Adds ability to open app logs from Settings dialog and progress views - `copyable-span` web component to support copying to clipboard from web views - Additional logging for shell executions and environment errors ![python-env-requirements-message](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/assets/40003442/0e40ddd8-3c85-4dde-8ed7-30cfe0d6c005)

comment.body:
> A spinner, or even better logs during live installation would be a great future enhancement.

there is actually a subtle [animation](https://github.com/jupyterlab/jupyterlab-desktop/blob/master/src/assets/progress-logo.svg) of the orange part of the logo, like heart beat. but probably too subtle to notice.

issue.title: CTRL+Z don't do the operation
issue.body: Dear all, When I use the keyboard shortcut `CTRL`+`Z`, the application asks me to save my work before closing the window. If I use the Edit/Undo drop-down menu, everything works normally. Best regards Simon
